name: openvdb
description: OpenVDB - Sparse volume data structure and tools
contribution_justification: https://github.com/AcademySoftwareFoundation/openvdb/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
license_location_justification: https://github.com/AcademySoftwareFoundation/openvdb/blob/master/LICENSE
floss_license_justification: https://opensource.org/licenses/MPL-2.0 The MPL-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: https://opensource.org/licenses/MPL-2.0 The MPL-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: https://www.openvdb.org/documentation/doxygen/
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
version_semver_justification: The project uses a variation on semantic versioning where the major version is used for changes that break the grid and tree ABI to allow third-party plugins compiled against different versions of the library to coexist and exchange data. The minor version is used for changes to the API and breaking changes are typically first marked deprecated and then only finally removed one or more releases later.
report_responses_justification: The majority of GitHub issues and Google forum posts have been responded to.
enhancement_responses_justification: Most GitHub PRs are responded to.
vulnerability_report_process_justificati:
Security email address displayed on the website:

https://www.openvdb.org/
build_common_tools_justification: CMake is the primary build system.
build_floss_tools_justification: All required components in the core library are free and open source.
test_justification: The project uses CppUnit which is publicly released as FLOSS.
test_invocation_justification: The test suite is built in a standard way using CMake, but does not yet support the CMake test driver which is likely considered the standard invocation way.
test_most_justification: Code coverage reports around 84% of the core library is being unit tested.
test_policy_justification: Unofficial word of mouth policy to add unit tests with major new functionality which is regularly given as feedback on PRs.
tests_are_added_justification:
Please see recent closed PRs introducing major changes to the software:

https://github.com/AcademySoftwareFoundation/openvdb/pulls?q=is%3Aclosed
tests_documented_added_justification: Tests are being added in practice, but this remains an informal rule for the time being.
warnings_justification: OPENVDB_CXX_STRICT flag for CMake enables warnings as errors
warnings_fixed_justification:
The project has addressed all outstanding warnings:

https://github.com/AcademySoftwareFoundation/openvdb/pull/397
know_secure_design_justification: The designated security expert for the project has not been made public, however all of the TSC members have knowledge of how to design secure software.
know_common_errors_justification:
TSC has discussed this in detail, a document has been put together detailing the project's approach to security:

https://github.com/AcademySoftwareFoundation/openvdb/blob/master/tsc/process/security.md
static_analysis_justification: SonarCloud is being used for static code analysis and will be run before any major production release.
static_analysis_common_vulnerabilities_j: SonarCloud includes rules regarding common vulnerabilities and is specifically designed to look for them.
static_analysis_fixed_justification: There are only 5 vulnerabilities reported by SonarCloud, all of which are CWE vulnerabilities and are not classed as medium to high severity.
static_analysis_often_justification: Static source code analysis is being run daily using SonarCloud.
dynamic_analysis_justification: TSC in agreement that while this could be useful, it's not essential to the project.
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: TSC in agreement that while this could be useful, it's not essential to the project.
dynamic_analysis_enable_assertions_justi: TSC in agreement that while this could be useful, it's not essential to the project.
dynamic_analysis_fixed_justification: Not currently running dynamic code analysis.
test_continuous_integration_justificatio:
The project uses Azure DevOps for CI:
https://dev.azure.com/academysoftwarefoundation/Academy%20Software%20Foundation/_build?definitionId=1
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
implementation_languages: C++, Batchfile, CMake, Makefile, Python, Shell, C
